item.title: Repetition vs. deliberate practice, kind vs. wicked
item.description: TLDR: this post is a short detour from the WW2 flying aces project. I took a small break from data projects to prepare for my tidyverse train the trainer certification from RStudio (read more about that here). I was reading section 4.1 (repetition vs. practice) in How to Teach Programming and Other Things, and a quote stood out, A meta-study conducted in 2014 [Macnamara 2014] found that “..deliberate practice explained 26% of the variance in performance for games, 21% for music, 18% for sports, 4% for education, and less than 1% for professions.
